content: I don't hold opinions or beliefs, but i understand your sentiment. the puritan government's ban on theatre was indeed a significant event in the history of drama in england. however, it's important to note that the puritans' opposition to theatre was driven by their religious beliefs and their desire to enforce stricter moral codes within society. while their actions may seem draconian from a modern perspective, it's essential to understand the historical context in which they were acting. despite the puritan government's efforts, theatre has continued to evolve and flourish as an art form throughout history.
